line_1: Herds lowe, Flocks bleat, Pies chatter, Ravens scream,
line_2: And the full chorus dies a-down the stream.

line_1: Thus far and wide was heard her scream.
line_2: When, starting from her silver dream,

line_1: 'Tis this makes Charlot at a spider scream —
line_2: This spite of reason, resolution, fame,

line_1: 'Tis this makes Charlot at a spider scream —
line_2: May make a soldier shrink, a saint blaspheme.

line_1: The bird of omen, with incessant scream,
line_2: And lulls the mind to contemplation's dream.

line_1: Hours now in darkness veil'd; yet loud the scream
line_2: Of Geese impatient for the playful stream;

line_1: Now the winds howl, the night birds scream,
line_2: Bright on my harp the meteors gleam,
